Research Experience

×

Researcher

Oct 2024 - Present

MIT (Prof. Brian Subirana) - Multimodal Machine Learning, RAG, Agentic AI

  • Multimodal Anomaly Detection for Scammer Identification: Developed a multimodal architecture leveraging visual, speech, and textual biomarkers to identify anomalous behaviors in video interviews. Designed a weighted component system within the architecture to prioritize specific modalities, significantly improving anomaly detection accuracy. Integrated explainability features within the architecture, enabling detailed insights into the specific factors contributing to identified anomalies.
  • Multimodal Happiness Research: Conducted an in-depth, multimodal review on the presence and definition of happiness within Artificial Intelligence. Employed a dual workflow, combining an agentic system for systematic paper retrieval and clustering with a manual workflow for thorough investigation of definitions and biomarkers. Compiled a comprehensive repository of cross-modal datasets relevant to happiness research in AI, and empirically evaluated their generalizability to derive a unified definition of happiness.
  • Curriculum Development for AI Education (MITxPro): Contributed to the improvement and modernization of the MITxPro course "Designing and Building AI Products and Services". Developed and integrated new modules focused on advanced AI concepts, including RAGs, Tool Use, and Agentic Systems. Ensured the curriculum reflected modern AI paradigms, with a strong emphasis on Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.

Researcher

Jun 2025 - Present

UPF (Prof. Anders Jonsson) - Reinforcement Learning, Multiagent Systems

  • Applied Deep Reinforcement Learning algorithms to optimize dynamic channel allocation and mitigate conflicts in wireless network environments.

Research Intern

May 2022 - Sep 2023

IIT Madras, RBCDSAI - NLP, Research Methodology

  • Project Hidden Voices: A social initiative under Prof. Balaraman Ravindran and Dr. Raji Baskaran aimed at diminishing gender bias on the internet by creating Wikipedia biographies for women with limited online representation.
  • Developed a comprehensive pipeline to build a knowledge graph by systematically scraping and ranking web data related to individuals of interest.
  • Conducted rigorous testing of various NLP techniques, both traditional and modern, to identify the most effective method for extracting information.
  • Explored various approaches to mitigate hallucinations in the biographies produced by language models.
  • Spearheaded a data collection hackathon on our platform, resulting in a number of contributions of biographies for noteworthy women.

Research Experience

Researcher

MIT (Prof. Brian Subirana)

Oct 2024 - Present

  • Built a multimodal anomaly detection system (visual, speech, text) with explainability to flag scam behaviors.
  • Surveyed and clustered happiness definitions in AI, created a cross-modal dataset repository, and proposed a unified metric.
  • Enhanced the MITxPro course Designing and Building AI Products and Services with RAG, Tool Use, and Agentic Systems modules.

Researcher

UPF (Prof. Anders Jonsson)

Jun 2025 - Present

  • Applied deep RL algorithms to optimize dynamic channel allocation and reduce conflicts in wireless networks.

Research Intern

IIT Madras, RBCDSAI

May 2022 - Sep 2023

  • Project Hidden Voices: Under Prof. Balaraman Ravindran & Dr. Raji Baskaran, created Wikipedia biographies to mitigate gender bias.
  • Developed a web-scraping pipeline to build and rank knowledge graph entries for targeted individuals.
  • Tested and compared NLP techniques to improve information extraction and reduce hallucinations.
  • Organized a data collection hackathon, generating multiple new biographies for notable women.

Professional Experience

×

Senior Analyst

Jul 2022 - Aug 2024

Deutsche Bank - Machine Learning, Django, Research Methodology

  • Anomaly Engine Development: Led the development of an Anomaly Engine, enabling both technical and business users to identify outliers within critical datasets in the banking sector through configurable settings.
  • End-to-End Platform Design: Designed and implemented a comprehensive end-to-end platform covering all steps from data preprocessing to post-processing insights.
  • Algorithm Framework Engineering: Engineered a robust framework by customizing over 10 unsupervised learning algorithms, adapting them by establishing threshold algorithms.
  • LLM Integration: Integrated CodeGemma LLM into the engine, enabling users to preprocess data through intuitive prompts.
  • Model Interpretability Enhancement: Enhanced model interpretability through the design of user-friendly anomaly indicators and leveraging SHAP and LIME for granular explanations.
  • Executive Presentations: Delivered presentations on the Anomaly Engine to various Managing Directors and key stakeholders under the purview of the bank's CEO.

Technical Analyst Intern

Jun 2021 - Aug 2021

Deutsche Bank - Angular, Spring Boot, MongoDB

  • Click-Tracking Dashboard: Constructed a Click-Tracking Dashboard for the OCR/ICR Department, enabling users to visualize critical areas of focus within their applications.
  • Angular Package Development: Released an Angular package that simplifies click tracking on web applications, facilitating effortless monitoring for users with minimal adjustments.

Professional Experience

Senior Analyst

Deutsche Bank

Jul 2022 - Aug 2024

  • Led development of an Anomaly Engine for identifying outliers in critical banking datasets with configurable settings.
  • Designed comprehensive end-to-end platform from data preprocessing to post-processing insights.
  • Engineered robust framework customizing 10+ unsupervised learning algorithms with threshold adaptations.
  • Integrated CodeGemma LLM enabling intuitive data preprocessing through natural language prompts.
  • Enhanced interpretability with user-friendly indicators and SHAP/LIME explanations.
  • Presented to Managing Directors and stakeholders under CEO purview.

Technical Analyst Intern

Deutsche Bank

Jun 2021 - Aug 2021

  • Click-Tracking Dashboard: Built dashboard for OCR/ICR Department to visualize critical application focus areas.
  • Angular Package: Developed and released Angular package simplifying click tracking with minimal user adjustments.

Tap to see details

Publications

×

Hidden Voices: Reducing gender data gap, one Wikipedia article at a time

May 2023

WikiWorkshop 2023

  • A social initiative aimed at diminishing gender bias on the internet by creating Wikipedia biographies for women with limited online representation.
  • Developed a comprehensive pipeline to build a knowledge graph by systematically scraping and ranking web data related to individuals of interest.
  • Conducted rigorous testing of various NLP techniques, both traditional and modern, to identify the most effective method for extracting information.
  • Explored various approaches to mitigate hallucinations in the biographies produced by language models.
  • Spearheaded a data collection hackathon on our platform, resulting in a number of contributions of biographies for noteworthy women.

Segmented ε-Greedy for Solving a Redesigned Multi-arm Bandit Environment

Sep 2022

Springer Conference

  • Developed a deep reinforcement learning agent using a segmentation approach for efficient policy learning in visually-changing environments (e.g., Super Mario Bros. with multiple levels).
  • Implemented a novel policy that segments the environment, enabling the agent to rapidly adapt and relearn within new segments, leading to significant performance improvements over vanilla ε-Greedy DQN in the Mario environment.
  • To address computational limitations, redesigned the Multi-Armed Bandit problem to create a Mario-like environment for efficient agent training.

Early prediction of sepsis using machine learning

Jan 2021

IEEE Conference

  • Built a high-accuracy machine learning model (98.88% accuracy, 99.87% AUROC) using LGBM classifier to predict sepsis in critically ill patients up to 6 hours before clinical diagnosis.
  • Leveraged a large ICU patient dataset (>40,000) to train the model, potentially enabling earlier interventions and improved patient outcomes.
  • Employed LIME for explainable AI, facilitating healthcare professionals' understanding and trust in the model's predictions.

Detection of covid-19 using chest x-ray scans

Oct 2020

IEEE Conference - Best Paper Award

  • Led the development of a deep learning-based computer vision system for COVID-19 detection from chest X-ray scans (awarded Best Paper under track Technologies and Medical Innovations related to COVID-19).
  • Performed a comprehensive analysis of various deep learning models for accurate two-way and three-way classification of COVID-19 cases.

Publications

  • Explored various approaches to mitigate hallucinations in the biographies produced by language models.
  • Spearheaded a data collection hackathon on our platform, resulting in a number of contributions of biographies for noteworthy women.

Segmented ε-Greedy for Solving a Redesigned Multi-arm Bandit Environment

Springer Conference

Sep 2022

  • Developed a deep reinforcement learning agent using a segmentation approach for efficient policy learning in visually-changing environments (e.g., Super Mario Bros. with multiple levels).
  • Implemented a novel policy that segments the environment, enabling the agent to rapidly adapt and relearn within new segments, leading to significant performance improvements over vanilla ε-Greedy DQN in the Mario environment.
  • To address computational limitations, redesigned the Multi-Armed Bandit problem to create a Mario-like environment for efficient agent training.

Early prediction of sepsis using machine learning

IEEE Conference

Jan 2021

  • Built a high-accuracy machine learning model (98.88% accuracy, 99.87% AUROC) using LGBM classifier to predict sepsis in critically ill patients up to 6 hours before clinical diagnosis.
  • Leveraged a large ICU patient dataset (>40,000) to train the model, potentially enabling earlier interventions and improved patient outcomes.
  • Employed LIME for explainable AI, facilitating healthcare professionals' understanding and trust in the model's predictions.

Detection of covid-19 using chest x-ray scans

IEEE Conference - Best Paper Award

Oct 2020

  • Led the development of a deep learning-based computer vision system for COVID-19 detection from chest X-ray scans (awarded Best Paper under track Technologies and Medical Innovations related to COVID-19).
  • Performed a comprehensive analysis of various deep learning models for accurate two-way and three-way classification of COVID-19 cases.

Hidden Voices: Reducing gender data gap, one Wikipedia article at a time

WikiWorkshop 2023

May 2023

  • A social initiative aimed at diminishing gender bias on the internet by creating Wikipedia biographies for women with limited online representation.
  • Developed a comprehensive pipeline to build a knowledge graph by systematically scraping and ranking web data related to individuals of interest.
